content.body: I would appreciate if someone would double-check my reading of the rules for choosing a navigable in https://github.com/whatwg/html/issues/11291 . It is surprising that this basic thing was missed for some time.
in firefox on linux both the links and the buttons each open new tabs
* in firefox on linux both the links and the buttons all open new tabs

m.new_content.body: in firefox on linux both the links and the buttons all open new tabs

content.body: ah that's what the issue says

I kind of vaguely remember something about the _“non-empty target names, other than _top, _self, and _parent, are treated like _blank in terms of deciding whether to open a new browsing context”_ text cited from that MDN page

content.body: after checking now, I can see it’s been in there for more than 4 years — ever since the wiki days <https://github.com/mdn/content/blame/7a4949c39200965c35633b89ea0d7b5016a381e6/files/en-us/web/api/window/open/index.html>

content.body: So… don’t know who might have added it to MDN originally, or when — but I guess they may just have discovered it from testing

For MDN, we still regularly get PRs that are cases of contributors saying, _“I can’t find where any spec says this is what’s supposed to happen, but some testing shows that this is what browsers are doing”_ for some particular thing
content.formatted_body: For MDN, we still regularly get PRs that are cases of contributors saying, “I can’t find where any spec says this is what’s supposed to happen, but some testing shows that this is what browsers are doing” for some particular thing

content.body: Domenic: I suspect we even test that, but forgot about it when we did the recent tightening of conditions there?
content.formatted_body: Domenic: I suspect we even test that, but forgot about it when we did the recent tightening of conditions there?

content.body: Hmm yeah, maybe I am just fooled by how clear the spec looks now
https://github.com/web-platform-tests/wpt/blob/master/html/browsers/windows/auxiliary-browsing-contexts/named-lookup-scoped-to-browsing-context-group.html is kind of a test but not comprehensive.

content.body: jarhar: is https://github.com/whatwg/html/pull/10548 up-to-date? It didn't have a working PR Preview until I fiddled with it just now... It doesn't have the nested list.
